meanings.definition: A line on a billiards table marking a boundary within which certain shots are required to be made.
meanings.sent1: The player aimed carefully at the balkline before taking the shot.
meanings.sent2: The chalk marks on the balkline helped players aim accurately.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat thought the balkline was a perfect place to nap.
meanings.sent4: The balkline acted as a strict border, dictating the player's next move.
meanings.sent5: The bright light highlighted the balkline, making it stand out on the table.

meanings.definition: To hesitate or be unwilling to proceed.
meanings.sent1: She would often balkline when asked to speak in front of a crowd.
meanings.sent2: The dog seemed to balkline at the sight of the unfamiliar object.
meanings.sent3: The child would balkline every time he had to eat his vegetables.
meanings.sent4: His fear of failure made him balkline at the idea of trying something new.
meanings.sent5: The team could not afford to balkline if they wanted to win the game.
